definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: It works better if the blade's back edge (spine) somewhat touches the inner back edge of the scabbard while drawing out (same while inserting in).
sentences.chinese: 如果刀背略微貼着刀削的背部拔出會更好，插入亦然。

sentences.english: Fork in left, knife in right. Index finger slightly blade on the knife.
sentences.chinese: 左手拿叉，右手拿刀，食指稍微按在刀背上。

sentences.english: On the back of many survival knives are a saw meant for sawing through metal or wood.
sentences.chinese: 很多生存刀的刀背上設有木鋸或鋼鋸齒。

sentences.english: Sprinkle some salt and pepper on both sides of each lamb chop, use chopper to press gently.
sentences.chinese: 在羊排正反兩面灑上鹽和胡椒，用刀背輕柔地壓一下。

sentences.english: He picked up a kitchen knife and began to use the knife cut his throat Schmidt.
sentences.chinese: 他拿起一把菜刀，開始用刀背割李某某的喉部。

sentences.english: Take the back of a knife and crack eggs evenly all around.
sentences.chinese: 用小刀的刀背把雞蛋的周圍劃破。

definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
hand formed into a flat shape, as for a karate chop
